definitions.definition: having four straight equal sides and four angles of 90°
forming an angle of 90° exactly or approximately

examples.text: The book had rounded, not square, corners.
He had a firm, square jaw.

definitions.definition: used after a number to give a measurement of area
used after a unit of measurement to say that something measures the same amount on each of four sides
used to describe something that is broad or that looks solid in shape
level with something or parallel to something

examples.text: tables arranged square with the wall

definitions.definition: if two people are square, neither of them owes money to the other

examples.text: Here's the £10 I owe you—now we're square.

definitions.definition: if two teams are square, they have the same number of points

examples.text: The teams were **all square** at half-time.

definitions.definition: fair or honest, especially in business matters

examples.text: Are you being square with me?
That isn't quite square with what you said yesterday.

definitions.definition: considered to be boring, for example because they are old-fashioned or work too hard at school
a good meal that satisfies your hunger

examples.text: He looks as though he hasn't had a square meal for weeks.

definitions.definition: a person who does not feel happy or comfortable in a particular situation, or who is not suitable for it

wordOrigin: Middle English: shortening of Old French esquare (noun), esquarre (past participle, used as an adjective), esquarrer (verb), based on Latin quadra ‘square’.
